result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
BOTH COUNTS: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect up to 25% prison funds. Remaining balance to be collected during the period of ES. If not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
- Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Count 3, with credit for 350 days time served

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Per Order dated June 22, 2022, Appeal No 2019AP1710-CRNM, 
IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.

Per Remittitur dated June 22, 2022, Appeal No 2019AP001710-CRNM, 
IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on November 23, 2021, that:
IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of the circuit court is summarily affirmed. See WIS. STAT.RULE 809.21. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Marcela DePeters is relieved of any further representation of Whitelaw in this matter. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3).

Per Order dated April 18, 2022, Appeal No 2019AP001710-CRNM, 
IT IS ORDERED that the court grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee. This order waives only the filing fees in the Supreme Court. It is not a determination of indigency for any other purpose. Indigency may be reevaluated if a request is received for waiver of other fees based on indigency.
Acknowledgement of Petition for Review has been filed with the Wisconsin Supreme Court - Appeal No 2019AP001710-CRNM

Per Order Dated November 23, 2021, Appeal No. 2019AP1710-CRNM, 
IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of the circuit court is summarily affirmed. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Marcela DePeters is relieved of any further representation of Whitelaw in this matter. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3).
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

records.addlTxt: Letter in support of Jerimy Whitelaw, received and filed.

Defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Anthony M. & Marilyn W. 

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 12 YEARS 6 MONTHS, consecutive to Count 3, with credit for 350 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, consecutive to Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

Court sets restitution at zero.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds. Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision. If not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

cf
-dated 1/11/16 from Wisconsin Forensic Unit, filed.  Copies mailed to counsel.
- signed and filed.

Same appearances.  Court places jury questions on the record.  Deliberations continue.  Exhibit #104 received.  At the hour of 2:40pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, rendered two verdicts as to COUNT 1. Court re-reads instruction to the jury.  Jury returns to jury room for continuation of deliberations.  At the hour of 3:05pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdicts of GUILTY as to lesser included offense (First Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety) on COUNT 1 and GUILTY on COUNT 3 which were then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict forms received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdicts.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Court orders PSI with recommendation.  Court orders defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.  On motion of defense counsel, Court orders psychological evaluation by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit as part of PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Filed, signed Order for Examination

Defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State reopens case for the purpose of admitting Exhibits.  Exhibits 102 and 103 received.  State rests.   Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and DENIED by the court as to COUNTS 1 and 3.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and GRANTED by the court as to COUNT 2.  Court orders COUNT 2 dismissed.  As to COUNT 1, parties stipulate to lesser included charge for jury consideration.  Court holds colloquy with defendant.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to testify.  Jury in box at 9:53am.  Defense rests.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 11:30am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Debra Walls and Mark Pawlak who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Court stands in recess for the lunch hour.

Filed, Jury Instructions

Trial proceeds.  Defendant's request for new counsel argued and DENIED by the Court.  Sworn for the State: DNA Analyst Jill McDounough, Firearms Analyst Xai Xiong, MPD Detective Michael Sarenac, MPD Detective Michael Walisiewicz.  Exhibits 91-96,99-101 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury is released for the evening at 4:30pm.  Trial to continue on 1/7/16 at 8:30am in Br. 35.

Defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury in box at 9:00am.  Trial proceeds. Sworn for the State: MPD Detective Craig Thimm, MPD Officer Hector Sosa, MPD ID Technician Chet St Clair, MPD Chief Latent Print Examiner Douglas Knueppel. MPD Detective Matthew Bell, MPD Officer David Letteer.  State places stipulation (exhibit #80) on the record.  Exhibits 79-90 received.  Court stands in recess for the lunch hour, trial to continue at 1:30pm.

Same appearances. Testimony of MPD Detective Michael Sarenac continues.  Sworn for the state:  MPD Officer Anthony Milone, MPD Detective Craig Thimm.  Exhibits 24,29,34,50-51,65,69-71,73-78 received.  Jury out of box at 4:56pm.  Court stands in recess, trial to continue on 1/6/16 at 8:30am in br. 35.

Defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury in box at 9:56am.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeds.  Sworn for the state: Detective Michael Sarenac.  Exhibits 1-23,30,35-36,38-49,52,55-62,66,67 received.  Court stands in recess for the lunch hour, trial to resume at 2:00pm.

Defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court places rulings on trial motions on the record.  Court orders witness sequestered.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeds at the hour of 11:03am.  Court stands in recess for the lunch hour.

Trial proceeds.  Voir dire continues.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Jury out of box at 4:45pm.  Court stands in recess, trial to continue on 1/5/16 at 9:30am in br. 35.
state's witness list/state's requested jury instructions/state's motion in limine, filed.

Defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court holds conference with counsel in chambers off the record, matter is called on the record.  SPEEDY trial demand was filed on 9/28/15 (expires 12/28/15).  Trial date is outside speedy trial time frame.  Defendant waives time limits until trial date.  Court orders speedy trial demand extended to 1/4/16.  State to file final pretrial documents within 10 days.  Defense places discovery issue on the record.  State to turn over additional discs (1,2,3,5) to defense within 7 days.  Matter remains scheduled for jury trial on 1/4/16 at 9:30am in Room 632 of the Courthouse.

Written demand for speedy trial received and filed.
Due date: 12/28/2015

Defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests adjournment due to additional discovery. Court hears argument. Court GRANTS request, no further adjournments will be granted to the State.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter remains in trial posture, matter remains scheduled for jury trial on 9/14/15 at 9:30am in Br. 35.

Case adjourned for final pretrial on 8.19.15 and for jury trial on 9.14.15.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 08-19-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 05-28-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw in custody.  Ron Dague for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Michael Walisiewicz-MPD Detective.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #06CF387 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (24 HOUR CURFEW) INCLUDING ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Jerimy Cordell Whitelaw in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
